reviews.review_msg: Boring lectures, but interesting material. Really nice woman who, when relating material to her work as a therapist or showing particular videos, can be very interesting. Hard exams.
reads off ppt slides word for word, voice so monotone and boring, it'll be the best 3 hr nap of your life. class not recommended unless required.

Dagmar is awesome and her exams are fair/easy. She has some interesting real-life examples because she works as a therapist as well. She shows a lot of video clips that are engaging and uses material right from the textbook. Love this class.

She's sweet and tries too engage students, but unfortunately doesn't really succeed. The lecture is so boring and lags on forever. Exams are textbook based, but will have some questions on the in-class videos (very few though). Textbook chapters are ridiculously long and full of useless information. Exams are pretty hard; memorize the textbook.

Found her extremely dull and lazy. She literally reads her slides word for word. I didn't go to class for over a month and did better than average on the midterm. MC part of tests are ridiculous, and destroyed my entire class. Also, the textbook is wordy, long, and fairly uninteresting. Very disappointing.
Excellent prof, she knows what she is doing, and does her best to make sure you are prepared for her exams. I would take ANY class with this prof. Her exams are for the most part, very fair.
Caroline is so nice. She answers all the questions and her lectures are very clear. Her tests are very fair, really enjoyed this course.
Such an interesting topic somehow made into the most dull class I have ever taken. Was hoping for so much more.

She is the most boring professor to listen to. Shows videos every class which are a waste of time and not testable. Her multiple choice questions are pretty hard, but short answer are easy. Textbook chapters are long and she cover maybe 1/16 of the material in lecture. Would not take a class with her again.

I have read the textbook inside and out. And I still somehow failed the Multiple choice part of the exams. She is dull and boring and find myself unable to focus during her lectures. I highly recommend taking the class with another prof if possible.

This is my second time taking Psyc 241 after taking interventions (psyc371) last semester (A-). Despite how hard I'm studying for these exams my multiple choice grades are around a C+ average but I'm getting perfects in my short answers. I feel like there's something wrong with the MC section like wording or something that's screwing me over.
this class is sooo dull... put some life into will ya? jeez...

Refused to give me an extension on an assignment even though I provided a doctor's note because he wanted more detail in the noteâ€¦.. I guess he doesn't believe in students having a reasonable right to privacy. Completely unsympathetic on top of being a monotone & unenthusiastic prof. I took 300W with him before this too and it sucked. Avoid him !
For an online class he was engaging and kind to the students. The midterms are online and are not too hard but still challenging. Loved the class super interesting material
You have to listen carefully to what he says on the lectures otherwise you will fail. Papers and assignments are marked harshly.

Weekly materials are heavier than other courses at similar level in my opinion. Criteria and outline is clear, lecture materials match the textbook, the exams are straight-forward but very shortly timed though. But reasonable since its open-book and all done online.

PSYC241 was awful & emotionally taxing. Despite the course concerning mental illnesses & neurodiversity, his course is designed in an inaccessible manner for neurodivergent students. He expects students to answer the exams coherently and comprehensively but does not give them the appropriate time to do so. Assignments are marked like it's PSYC300W.

DONT TAKE ONLINE. Took really interesting material and made it torture to learn. If u struggle with auditory retention these lectures are a nightmare. His delivery is monotone and so convoluted, sounds like he is reading straight from a textbook, but the lecture slides are useless so u have to focus hard on what he says. Had to rewind every word.

A blended course, there is an online part with textbook quizzes which are time-consuming but not bad. Exams can seem hard but will do well if you study. There is a reflection in some lectures. Prof seemed to care about students.

She was fine just super rude to students, saying things like "I dont know how hard that is to understand" and just very snappy things all the time. Exams were easy if you study and lecture material is simple.  took this in the summer and it was blended, so a lot of the material was the interactive textbook that has little quizzes, etc.
nice guy. uses the same notes and everything, every single year

Very good prof and fun course to take. In the exams there aren't a lot from lecture, maybe a few MC's and 1 SA. Very helpful too. It's not a lot to memmorize compared to 280. If someone still thinks there's too much to memorize in PSYC241, then PSYC and perhaps even University is not for you.

make sure you study his lecture notes! a lot of questions on the exam come from them. He's a good prof... had trouble hearing what he said sometimes and that was really annoying! the material near the end of the semester gets really interesting! especially the section about sexual dysfunctions haha.
Did not really attend much...so....but~ the ones I attended were fun. Funny prof and the course material were interesting.

Very dedicated to his work, yet did not meet my expectations. There is an overwhelming amount of detail to remember for his course based on etiology and treatment paradigms. Requires lots of reading and staggering memory recall. In class videos are a nice touch, but the lectures are somewhat monotonous. Heavy course content does not do him justice.
this is my favourite prof out of all.  you can definetly see that he knows what he's talking about and that he enjoys what he's doing. class is interesting and videos are educational.

Ppl say he mumbles, I disagree. Or at least its not as prevalent. He has a lot of exprience in the subject and relates it in lectures making them interesting. Uses humor and an easy going approach to cover difficult/hard to swallow subjects (ie paraphilia). Incorporates videos into lectures. Interesting/relevant assignment.

he FAILED me... i still dun get it... i understood the course material, took the tests and essay... and he still failed me... what da hell? and he walks around alot, always mumbles,dun even understand what he meant. textbook sucks too. videos are boring, too 70's 80's.dun take him if u want to pass.
Great prof... tells lots of "interesting" stories. He would be a great guy to sit down and have a beer with!
not clear, tends to ramble about irrelevant stuff
doesnt speak so clearly, but he knows a lot about the subject and has good experience. Some of his commentaries and use of words are funny. In general very good.
Freak'n Hillarious!!! Experience makes him interesting!
He is a wonderful teacher...The personal stories really make the class!  Too bad this is his last semester teaching!!!!
good class ... he tells a lot of stories
really interesting course
No Comments
Attendance wasn't required, but lectures were not recorded, so if you like to re-listen to lectures, record it yourself

Great prof; fantastic lectures and a good sense of humor. She knows her content and always makes lectures interesting with examples. Her notes have most of the info you'll need and the textbook helps supplement them. Very clear voice and conveys material in an engaging way. Course is pretty content heavy, but very interesting and worth the effort.
I liked going to Stephen for help as he was very helpful. I am still disappointed he would not increase my midterm mark but I couldn't argue with his rationale.

I know Stephen was just the TA for this course but I wanted to provide a rating. I found Stephen to be extremely helpful! Although he did not give me any extra marks on my exam, he was really good at explaining course topics and helping me with strategies to improve my grade in the exams. He was much more knowledgeable than the actual instructor.

I took in Fall 2024 and seems to me that she didnt care about course. You should listen online her lecture slides, but you will figure out that she just read notes on slides and do not add any comments or thoughts. She only cares about her PhD topic - eating disorders. You will have only one lecture in person - her lovely eating disorders topic
3 exams, all in person. Memorize the lecture slides and you'll ace this course--nothing else really matters.

Shannon was good prof, it was clear what material we needed to know for the exams. Entire course was graded on two midterms and final. Read the textbook and watch all the lecture videos and you'll do well

Overall, a good professor. She is obviously knowledgeable and wants you to learn and appreciate the content. Mostly online, but your entire grade is made up of two midterms and a final. Exams were pretty straightforward though, if you study the lecture content you will do well since all questions are pretty much from there.

This was mostly online but some lectures & all 3 exams were in-person. It was a pretty easy class, just listen to lecture videos and do the readings and you'll do good. Questions on the exam are pulled from those two so there's no surprises.

Mostly online course, and you only are graded on 3 things (2 midterms and a final) Shannon is very nice and tries to make the course easy and manageable. No surprises on the exams just watch the lectures read the textbook and study.
Such a nice professor. The class was fun and she was really approachable. She cared about her students and tried to make our lives as easy as possible (it was an intersession course).

I took this intersession and I was worried at first but it worked out. Shannon is a pretty good lecturer and her TAs were helpful this semester. We were only graded on 3 exams that were worth 20%. 30%, and 50%, but if you go to lecture and study your notes and read/skim each chapter, you should do fine. There are no surprises if you keep up!

Professor and TAs were not accessible at all and ignore emails. No communication with students. Grades were based on one assignment and three exams. The writing assignment was easy and the exams were heavily lecture-based. The course is manageable, but preferably take it with a different professor.

disappointing class. She lacked complete communication with students, didn't show up for 2 of 3 exams and lectures were average. Reading off a paper essentially. Exams are lecture heavy. Didn't touch the textbook. The average for the first exam was abt 58% but made it easier after. Avg ended up b-. take other profs if can. if not, its survivable.

A mistake I made in this course was read the textbook and not watch the lectures. The exams had questions taken directly from lectures that were never mentioned in the textbook, but the lectures were a bit long to sit through. The final writing assignment is easy, but it was an overall demanding course that required a lot of time and work put in

Shannon is really good at explaining the concepts. I do agree that her exam and lectures are heavy but the course is meant to be. but the best part is nothing she assesses is out of lecture and textbook and they are very straight forward. No assignments were needed just 2 midterms and 1 final. weekly reading and lecture and that's it

The assignments are really easy, but the tests are heavy on both the textbook and lectures, which take up a lot of your time to read and memorize. Other than that, she's not bad, and depending on the TA's you should be able to get a good grade if you put the time in.

1 assignment, 3 midterms; multiple choice and short answer, 1 cumulative "quiz". Assignement was super easy and midterms and quiz are straight forward if you read and memorize the textbook chapters. While just memorizing the textbook will get you a good mark on the mc, you need to watch the lectures to do well on the sa.

Professor Zaitsoff is a very understanding professor. There were 3 exams and 1 assignment. The assignment was very straightforward and easy to complete. The exams were very challenging and the short answer questions were marked tough. Overall, to do well in this class, you have to study lecture notes and read the textbook thoroughly.

I was quite worried throughout the semester about this class (intersession). The short answer portions of the midterms I found to be very challenging in terms of what to include. I will say in the end the grades worked out, but it was still pretty unsettling. My only major complaint is how often she says et cetera (kidding). Overall, she's good.

Not accessible outside of class and ignores emails. Took this as an online class and she reused a 3 hour audio recording for an in class lecture, which was hard to follow considering the audio quality. MC tests were fair and mostly lecture based.

Honestly, a pretty decent prof. She definitely knows what she is talking about and explains it in a clear way. I took psyc241 online and all the lectures were posted, she drops the lowest test mark so if you do poorly on one test, you have 3 others to make up for it. She gave us diagnostic assignments which were easy A's. Overall a good experience

In my opinion, she's the only professor that has been good with going online bc of covid-19. Her lectures are engaging especially if you're interested in the topics. Her tests are fair and well written. Slides don't have all the info so if you want to do well you have to listen to them. Textbook is needed. Highly recommend her!

While I'm not a fan of her method of lecturing, I recommend taking this class with her. It's absolutely necessary to attend lectures and take notes because it narrows down what you need from the textbook (very dense). Her 2 ta's taught 2 of the topics and they were ok. Dr. Zaitsoff is also very understanding and nice to talk to. Exams only!

took psyc241 with her in spring2020, it was online for the last 3rd of the term because of covid-19. She was super understanding of the situation and gave good options regarding taking the final. All the tests were multiple-choice, and all the info was directly from textbook and lectures. She posted lec slides. One of the best psyc courses at sfu

Shannon is a very caring prof. Her lectures are easy to follow and she uploads slides which helps for studying. I didn't always read the textbook/just skimmed it and I did well on tests just by studying lecture notes. Shannon is always open to answering questions and lecture material is interesting. Attending lectures is not super crucial

Lectures for this class are three hours, which sounds like a long time, but Shannon is extremely engaging and makes the lectures fly by! I found the online textbook very glitchy and dry. However, her lectures are informative and if you have a genuine interest in the subject, the class isn't so bad. Her exams are very fair if you do the readings too

I absolutely adored Shannon! The lectures were three hours but you barely noticed the time fly by. She is a very engaging prof and her lectures were well organized and relatable. The only con for this class was the textbook. It was very dry and hard to read. I definitely feel my grade suffered because of how difficult it was to read those chapters.

Great Professor. Gives interesting lectures and is very clear about what information you will be tested on. Approachable, caring and gives fair testing. 100% of your mark is based on midterms. It's an easy class to do well in if you do the readings, come to class and study for exams. I'd highly recommend the course and Shannon.
Engaging and explained theories and information clearly. She was also very nice.
Grades were only based on 3 tests, no assignments. If you attend lecture and read the textbook chapters you'll be fine.
Shannon is nice and approachable, she offers something enjoyable

Shannon was a really nice prof who strived to make class more discussion based. Lectures were informative, and exams required little from the textbook but skimming through the chapters before the exams helped. Overall a very caring and nice prof who just wants the best for her students.
Lectures are extremely cut and dry. Reads of slides and gives examples when needed.

I loved taking a class with Shannon! She speaks very clearly and gives you a lot of valuable information of the material during lecture. Like any class, make sure you show up, ask questions if you're confused, and do the readings. I would definitely take another class with her.

Shannon is a smart and kind prof. Her lectures aren't amazing, but they aren't bad, either. Her lectures and powerpoints are all based out of the textbook in a simplified manner. However, if an A is your aim, I recommend focusing on studying the textbook. The slides and lectures alone are not enough for an A. Decent prof, though.

Dryest class I have ever taken. She read the slides, the end. I did all my studying by reading text and ppts on my own. Info is really interesting and the class covers great material, but it's a shame she teaches it. Only has 2 tests so it isn't engaging at all. Found her useless to approach outside of class; no info on anything not covered in lec.

The course is only graded based on 2 midterms and a final (each midterm is worth 30% and the final is worth 40%). It's helpful to read the textbook but you could probably pass without using it. Her lectures are really clear and she gives out the slides ahead of time. A great prof, and the TA's were great too!
Found the course very interesting and material was presented well. Seemed clear what would be on the exam, no surprises.

This professor was very unclear as to what she wanted in class. Her exams were brutal (comparing them to 3rd year courses). She is very self-centred and makes the lectures about her and how she is a well-known psychologist. All you'll hear about is her obsession with eating disorders. Definitely not recommended. She gets a D as a prof.

Shannon is so frustrating. She does not communicate well, misses her own lectures and does not help students at all, completely incompassionate. She asks vague questions, especially the ones for extra credit were about some random anecdote she had mentioned from her own life. Sorry, I came for Intro To Abnormal Psychology and not Intro To Shannon

Lecture could be a little heavy at times, but the material is interesting (if you are in psych) There are 2 midterms and a final, and all MC questions. Overall, the class is not hard if you put in the time and work.

She doesn't allow her lectures to be recorded, has extensive presentations and is pretty boring. Papers are vague, questions are vague.. She misses lectures, doesn't show up for the exam. Her extra questions are random nonsense like what colour did I wear on the fifth Tuesday, like how do I know!? Avoid her. Not just in this class but in life.

Doctor Shannon Zaitsoff is awesome, and don't listen to the revenge posts on here. She is by far the best professor I've had and taking here is something that you won't regret. She cares about the field and state of psychology and she is out to train great psychologists.  She gets the good classes for a reason and taking her class is a pleasure

Barely there as a prof. Skipped 2 lectures and had her TAs teach them (rather poorly) and disappears during exams once they've been handed out. Her tests are pretty easy but poorly worded and she won't change grades if you try to argue about unclear questions. Definitely would never take again.

I did not like her at all. She didn't seem sure when students asked her questions that weren't in the textbook, made it seem like she made it up based on her experience which is antidotal. Out of the 12 week semester she missed 2classes so TAs had to teach but 1 of them had NO clue. Easy exam, don't need textbook.

Dr. Zaitsoff is very knowledgeable about the subject matter, and provides a strong foundation for understanding material in lecture. While attending lecture is enough to scrape by, the textbook is required for a full, comprehensive grasp of the subject matter and to get a mark above a B-. Exams comprised of both lecture and textbook material.

She is a great prof. Her lecture slides are organized, thorough and easy to follow. You can tell she is interested in what she is teaching and is well informed and able to answer all questions. The exams are fair and quite easy if you attend lecture. Overall, she is very nice and a great prof, I would definitely recommend taking this course.

She is a great professor. Many people say her lectures were dull and boring, but for me, her lectures were very interesting. Pay great attention to what she says, as the notes on the powerpoint are vague, write down what she says during the class. Her exams are taugh, but you should do well when you pay attention in class. Highly recommended.

Shannon is a great prof! There were 3 exams (2 mid, 1 final) and honestly, you can do really well on them without reading the textbook. She did all m/c questions this term with great emphasis on looking over her power point slides. I would take another class with her again! The lectures were long, but overall it was a great class!

Shannon is a very kind and clear professor. She is always willing to help so make sure you approach her if you have any questions! However, she is monotone and lectures can drag which is difficult. Overall she's one of the better profs.
She is a great prof! She is very clear and the exams are fair. Plus she makes the material interesting. Definitely recommend taking it with her!

By far my favourite class.  Shannon is very knowledgable and her lectures are very clear.  Found this class interesting and managed to retain most of the info just from her lectures.  She outlines exams well so you know exactly what to expect.  Highly recommend this course, even if you're not a psyc major!

Lectures were interesting for the most part, exams are fair; you can easily score a decent mark by just studying her lecture slides, but if you're shooting for an A, definitely pay attention to the in-class videos and read the studies/details in the textbook.  Overall, great prof.

She is a good professor but the way that she gives out lecture is monotonous. The exams are easy and straightforward and the TAs are very helpful. Her lecture slides are not that informative, thus it makes it necessary to attend all the lectures.

She is such a lovely and interesting teacher. Really relates the material well and uses the textbook material in her lecture notes. Quite an interesting class to begin with, and she moves through the lectures in a relatable and time conscious manner

very clear and fair. the material itself is very interesting and she definitely knows what shes talking about. Very easy to do well in this class if you study a good amount for the exams. MC and short answer and all very fair.

Wow, she is an INCREDIBLY boring instructor. I don't get how she can teach such interesting material and fail to engage students or seem interested in it herself! Reading the textbook is more interesting than attending lecture, since her lecture is just based on the simplest points from the text.

GREAT PROF. She genuinely wants her students to succeed. She gives you an outline of what exactly she will cover in exams.  Her lecture material is all very relevant to exams and allows you to minimally read the textbook. Exams aren't too bad, study what she says and you'll be perfectly fine. Attend all lectures. Definite recommendation.

Abnormal Psychology was very interesting and the prof really encouraged discussion and questions from the class. Great prof all around, her lecture slides are wonderful and her lectures are never dry or dull. Short answers on the exams were the killer in this class. Overall enjoyable class, my favorite 2nd year Psychology class so far.
you learn a lot, but your anwsers are never right. for your exam you have to write like your a prof. Good luck getting more than 5 out of 10 on your long anwsers.

Great prof. She really knows her stuff and is willing to entertain questions in the class. You can tell that she wants us to learn from the class. A lot of the material is from the textbook but she does a lot of class activities and such that make the information meaningful and easier to remember

I LOVE THIS CLASS YESS I LOVE THE MULTIPLE CHOICE!!!    Yes, his class is that great.  To get a good grade though there is no question about the fact that you still have to do the work.  Id take a class with him again

Shona is super knowledgable and extremely caring. However, she's not the best teacher, lectures are jam-packed, long, and textbook heavy. I got a B and didn't go to the last half of the lectures, super nice lady but wish the lectures were more personal as she's sUPER passionate about what she teaches

Most boring class I have ever had. Literally no need to go to class other than to get the participation marks. She's a nice person but, she definitely can't teach. She also had a quiz due after all classes ended and papers are graded pretty harshly.

There are weekly open book quizzes and two papers throughout the semester. There are participation marks, but it is a pretty chill course. She is very entertaining and knowledgeable, she is definitely worth the time.
He's a hilarious man, but I still felt like I spent too much time laughing and not enough time learning.  Exams were challenging, but read the stuff and you'll be fine.

Steven is an Awesome prof! His lectures are super funny and interesting. I had this class at 8:30 in the morning and I didn't fall asleep. If you read the study guide, you'll do fine on his exams.... he even gives you the essay questions. Definately take this class with him.

hilarious man. it does tend to take him 2 full hours to get through what any other prof could cover in 15 minutes, but that's because he's telling tons of funny stories & swearing lots. absolutely lovable, just make sure you read the text or else you'll fail
very interesting and charismatic. tests are easy. get the study guide for the text and you'll have no problems!!
Very entertaining lectures. Utilizes a lot of his life experience to explain the material. Tells great stories and is funny too. A lot of reading in the class though, but no papers.
She is a practicing forensic psychologist rn, so she has lots of interesting and relevant examples to provide. She's super clear about what she will focus on during exams. Entertaining lectures!

I really loved Sarah's lectures! She was interesting, provided stories from her work as a clinical psychologist, and made the material easy to understand. Tests are mostly based on lecture slides but you do need to read the textbook thoroughly to get an A grade. Would definitely take another class with her!

Took 241 with Sarah, and it was my favourite course that semester! The course content was manageable. Sarah always allowed for discussion in her class and had such a high interest in what she was talking about. She would cover stuff not in the text, so attendance is recommended. If you have a high interest in abnormal psych, you'll love this class!

Loved 241 with Sarah. She was very detailed in her slides, and she was understanding. She was able to move my exam because I had a competition to attend. She is also very sweet and willing to answer questions at any time. You do have to read the text and go over the slides for the tests. There were 2 midterms and one final :) no papers.

I think Sarah is a decent prof. Her exams are based mostly off lecture with few multiple choice questions from the textbook but you can still ace an exam without reading it. She is a bit disorganized with her slides and doesn't always know how to answer questions, but she is quite funny and cheerful. Very approachable and interesting lectures.
